website_summaries.verdict: Slightly slower than some newer models, but this internal SSD still does a great job at a good price point.
pros: Delivers a read/write speed of up to 540 MB per second, which is a little slower than newer models but is still a good speed
Better energy efficiency than some others
cons: Will not work with Mac computers
May need to buy extra cables and brackets

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This drive is SMOKIN' (in a good way, no actual smoke was released from the product)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Carhuff

customer_reviews.title: Great drive.  Great price.  Bad software
customer_reviews.text: Great unit! Highly recommended. One caveat. If you have Windows 10, you will NOT be able to use the migration software that comes with the drive. When I connected the drive to my computer, it would not see it. I tried a new USB-SATA transfer cable, changing Windows settings and nothing worked. I finally went online and found the version of migration software that ships with the SSD is older and does not work with Windows 10. If you go to  you can grab the latest version and BOOM! Everything worked perfectly after that. The performance improvement is incredible. Well worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 2 years (21) months, and then it died.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, it only lasted less than 2 years (21 months) and then died. With such high reviews I expected at least 5 years from this SSD. I replaced the drive in my 2013 Mac Mini in October of 2016. Now, July of 2018, it bit the dust. Questioning going for another Samsung drive or switching. I'm sure it's a bad apple and not all the drives will have such a short lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: SCUD

customer_reviews.title: Major Boost to Computer Speed
customer_reviews.text: Love this drive. My Dell Inspiron 11, Series 3000 laptop was seriously underpowered. Painfully long boot-ups, slow to execute actions, lagging internet load-ups. Replaced the stock HDD with this SSD and I now have a real, responsive laptop that handles all my computing needs. The free "Magician" software that comes with the drive supposedly boosts drive speed astronomically, but I haven't really used the computer for heavy demands, like gaming or video editing, to see much of a benefit with that software. I'm sure in a higher-end computer this SSD will really shine. It was extremely easy to clone my HDD and install the SSD. And Samsung is a quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Max Headspace

customer_reviews.title: Love my Samsung SSD as well as the software that comes with it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: SAMSUNG stoves & dishwashers are garbage but their SSD's are wonderful!! BTW the Samsung Magician migration software is flawless. I started cloning the old drive using a USB adapter but noticed the transfer speeds were very limited by the bandwidth capabilities of the USB connection. I stopped the cloning process, connected the drive to the SATA connection and within 40 minutes 287 GB's had been cloned. I then connected the Samsung drive as the primary and it booted perfectly and its an exact copy of the old drive. It is really refreshing to have something work so well. All the games, apps etc. now run like they have rockets attached to their feet! My son is rockin with Titanfall2!
customer_reviews.author: Capt. S

customer_reviews.title: An excellent drive for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a failing disk drive in my mid-2011 Macbook Pro 15 inch. The replacement was easy, and just took a few minutes. (See numerous online instructions). I used MacOS Recovery (Command and R keys) and my recent backup to restore the computer. A little over an hour later, I was up and running again. My Macbook Pro starts up much faster, and I am please with the Samsung drive. The only issue I ran into was that Microsoft made me dig out my Office disk to input the code again, but that is a typical MS issue. Everything else is great. I highly recommend the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Mid-2009 MacBook Pro Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of reading and watching videos, because I couldn't afford to replace my Mac and hoped a few upgrades would help. I also bought and used the USB connector to format drive externally. First the reformatting went without a hitch grime Snow Leopard to Yosemite, second the installation was a breeze and finally the ABSOLUTE AMAZING FAST BOOT UP AND PERFORMANCE WAS WORTH IT!!! This was my first experience with a SSD and I couldn't believe how light it was, it almost feels physically nonexistent!! Absolutely happy I made the upgrade and also upgraded from 4GB of RAM to 8GB while I had the shell open.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Matus

customer_reviews.title: The Acronis software it came with made cloning my Windows installation easy. I'm very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old "failing" Crucial M4 with this when my UEFI and Windows wouldn't shut up about the wear leveling count. That drive is still functioning very well after continuous writes for three months after Windows and UEFI declared it to be dead, but that's beside the point. My first time booting with this drive compared to booting with the M4 was the same "wow" experience as my first time booting from the M4 compared to booting from 7200RPM WD Blacks. The Acronis software it came with made cloning my Windows installation easy. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Fivas

customer_reviews.title: Great, and fast, SSD!
customer_reviews.text: I put this into a Mac I got from a friend who was giving it away. He had to keep his HDD because it had things on it which he wanted to get off at a later date. I installed OS and that's been well over a year ago now. This thing is fast, and is running really strong! I am very happy with the craftsmanship that Samsung has had for years now and I am a true believer that their products are top of the line. If I need more SSD's I will definitely be going back to Samsung for more!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Webb

customer_reviews.title: Still working great. Pros
customer_reviews.text: Bought in July 2017. Still working great. Pros: - SSD Cons: - I like Samsung SSD's and have no complaints with it in terms of it doing what it's supposed to. However, one thing that has always annoyed me is that they don't print the size on the top... if you are screwing down your SSD into a drive mount then only the top side is visible. Get a couple differently sized Samsung drives over the years and you won't know which is which unless you've labeled them manually or taken the time to unscrew everything and verify. Doesn't seem like it would be all that difficult for them to correct either.
customer_reviews.author: R. Zilligen

customer_reviews.title: Poor reliability
customer_reviews.text: Got this ssd about 2 years ago( feb 2018) . Initially runs really fast. But then recently everything slows to a crawl. Yesterday when turning on the pc, it said it needs to repair the drive. After some work, it finally boot up and got the windows 10 to work. I had my regular western drives for over 10 years and none of them had ever failed. Isn’t ssd supposed to be much more reliable than the regular drives? At least I am lucky that this ssd has some warning before it totally fails. Looking for replacements now.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works with Macbook Pro Mid-2009
customer_reviews.text: Great SSD for a macbook pro. Very easy installation if you have the tiny screw driver set. Just create a bootable copy of OSX on a flash drive/HDD or backup with time machine, remove the old HDD and replace with SSD, boot from flash drive or external HDD, format the SSD, then install OSX or restore from time machine. My computer is 5 times as fast now and it only took 10 minutes to install the SSD and 2 hours to restore from time machine. P.S.- Be careful when removing the original HDD, as the ribbon connector is hidden underneath and can easily be broken with too much force.
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Delivered promptly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Delivered promptly. I am a retired IT tech. Samsung provides the easiest, most user friendly, migration/cloning software that I have seen. The process was very quick with no observed errors. A couple of notes for those of you that have not done much of this type of procedure before. Read the manual carefully! It is on the CD, it is not the very limited instructions that are provided in the box. Make sure that the source disk is in good condition. Cloning does not fix drive problems! In addition make sure that you have at least 10% of the capacity of your source disk free. If you don't the cloning process will, most likely, not be successful.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Brought new life to an old laptop computer!
customer_reviews.text: This drive is an excellent improvement to a 7 year old laptop that Windows 10 had slowed to a crawl and I had stopped using. Also excellent, in my opinion, is the enclosed Samsung cloning and data copying software. It automatically adjusted the "cloned" (old) drive size and data to the size of the new Samsung SSD drive, which not all cloning software will do, as I found out the hard way. The Samsung SSD, the included Samsung software, and awere all that were necessary to accomplish making this old laptop usable (and increasing its hard drive capacity) once again!
customer_reviews.author: SRez

customer_reviews.title: Loads much faster than the internal hard drive and still runs great years later even though it's constantly near full capacity
customer_reviews.text: Bought this over 2 years ago to play Fallout 4 on Xbox One and other frequently played games. Loads much faster than the internal hard drive and still runs great years later even though it's constantly near full capacity. The only issue I've come across is that if you're installing a new game to it while playing another game off of it, the hard drive will disconnect and the game you're playing will crash. I assume it's from issues with - or the inability to - read and write at the same time. A workaround is to just install to the hard drive first, then moving to the solid state from there takes very little time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect blend of price/storage
customer_reviews.text: Perfect blend of price/storage. You owe it to yourself to pick this up, a lot of the old 840 problems are fixed. Despite what a lot of people say about ssd failure, you should know that any products made will have defects that are not up to par. This goes for cars, tvs, even plastic forks, the same goes for ssd. You should backup your data regularly just in case your ssd does fail, but honestly, it is a very small chance of failure. Traditional hdds also have a chance of failing, same goes for ssd. Back up your important files!
customer_reviews.author: YU T.

customer_reviews.title: Great drive, just do a new install if using as your primary.  Dont waste time trying to migrate data.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second of these. Last night I installed this in a Dell E6430. I wish I had saved the headache and just went in with the plan to do a new install of Windows instead of using Samsung's Data Migration tool... Apparently the E6430 and this drive do not want to play together when you use the data migration tool. After 45 minutes of swapping drives back and forth, looking at prongs etc, I just said heck with it and booted to my thumb drive windows 10 installer and deleted the drive partitions from the data migration tool, reformatted and installed windows. DONE.
customer_reviews.author: Skape

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement in speed & no longer have a spinning disc drive
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my hard drive that came with my MacBook Pro, purchased in 2013. Easily installed in the 15 inch MacBook Pro. The data was then cloned over from the old HD to the Samsung 850 Evo. The system started up and my desktop, programs, and files were all there just as before. But the increase in speed was very impressive! Startup now takes 15-20 seconds, whereas the old drive needed a minute plus before you could work. Word, Powerpoint and Excel now load in under 2 seconds vs. the old 10-12 seconds. Files open immediately. A huge speed improvement, and with the solid state NAND storage, no mechanical spinning disc wear to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade for Xbox One!
customer_reviews.text: Very good SSD, basically the best bang for your buck in the SSD world. The EVO Pro is 'better' but for a normal consumer, this is the way to go. I use my SSD to store high demanding games for my Xbox One and it makes games start, load up, and quit very fast and seamless. Fallout 4's load times are cut in half, and very noticeable improvements in Forza 6, Witcher III & Middle Earth: Shadow of Mordor load times and stability. I just put the SSD in an enclosure and plugged it in, nothing I had to install or wait for, the Xbox One recognized it instantly! Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Fast and breathes life into old computers!
customer_reviews.text: Over 500 read/write sequential benchmark SATA III motherboard. Expect 500+ on any new model SSD. SATA II motherboards will get 200 to 300. Keep in mind that an HDD can only read/write around 80MB/s. An SSD in any new computer or older computer (10 years) is going to make the computer boot-up and load programs much faster than an HDD. Note: Be sure to have 8GB/s of RAM. The reason is not because SSD/s require more memory but if any computer is stuck with just 4GB/s of RAM and you like to have large programs open at the same time, you'll have a much better experience with 8 vs 4 GB.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Greatly increased speed and performance in 2011 Macbook Pro.
customer_reviews.text: Greatly increased speed and performance in 2011 Macbook Pro. Install was initially difficult. I utilized a external hard drive case to duplicate the drive previously installed on the macbook. It took me quite a while for me to get the mac to recognize the drive. Several restarts and a lot of angry internet searching later, the drive magically showed up (seriously didn't do anything besides restart the computer and reinsert the drive multiple times). After using disk utility to duplicate the drive, the physical swapping and installation was really easy. It has been installed now for about 4 months with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: A disk error occurred Press Ctrl+Alt+Del to restart -  after 1.5 years of use
customer_reviews.text: Great drive, great price but returned boot error after a little over a year of use. A disk error occurred Press Ctrl+Alt+Del to restart restarting only returned the same error, the drive was detected but would not boot. After several attempts the drive was no longer detected, I disconnected all of my drives, reconnected the Samsung 850 EVO 500GB and everything booted up fine. Reconnected other drives and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleR

customer_reviews.title: It has been working for so long even in different operating systems
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a replacement for my HDD drive in my MacBook Pro 13 inch late 2011. The migration process was perfect with Carbon Copy Cloner, and the installation I did for myself! (unwilling to pay huge costs). I worked really fine and my computer speeded really fast. Then, a few years later I decided to upgrade to a 1TB drive (same brand, same type), and I decided to use the previous SDD in my wife's computer (Windows 7, Dell). Again, the process was easy and I could backup everything from my wife's previous laptop. It is still working with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Performance is outstanding. I bought a 2015 27" 5K iMac with the 7200rpm 1TB disk. Much to my shagrin the system was unbearably slow. Performed like an old klunker machine. I bought the 500GB Samsung and enclosed it in an external USB 3.0 case and plugged it in. I didn't want to open the machine to install the drive since it's under warranty. Running as an external drive my system flies! Performance is fantastic and now I feel like it's a new iMac. Like it so much I bought a 250GB and installed it in an old Macbook Pro that I have and that's now usable again! Woo hoo!!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond DeMartini

customer_reviews.title: Your perfect go-to SSD!
customer_reviews.text: This is just perfect for what it is, a cheap, reliable, good performing SSD! Latency is not noticeable for general use, speeds are up to spec, it's reliable, great warranty, works out the box no BS needed! Just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: iBoolGuy

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Almost Great
customer_reviews.text: An SSD will impart the greatest improvement in system performance of any upgrade to a computer, and Samsung makes one of the best. The EVO line is their less expensive alternative to the pricier PRO line, but gives up almost nothing in performance. I would rate the drive a 5-star product except that the migration from hard disk to SSD changed the 100MB system area on the disk (for what reason I do not know) and left so little empty space there, you can't perform a disk image. I encountered an identical problem when I upgraded my wife's laptop storage to a Samsung 840 EVO.
customer_reviews.author: Crusader

customer_reviews.title: they're wicked fast and work great but............
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to also mention how well the Samsung Migration software (download the latest at Samsung website) works too. My Sony laptop has only one SATA port in use by the old mechanical drive so I had to temporarily use a USB to SATA docking station. Software had no trouble at all cloning the old 600GB disk with Windows7 64 bit and about 100GB of data on it over to the 500GB SSD. Took a while longer than expected so I just watched movie until it finished. My Sony Vaio laptop boots up so FAST now !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver!
customer_reviews.text: My first review on Amazon and I chose this product to review because it is one of the best purchases I’ve made. My laptop’s (Dell Inspiron 15 3000 series 2014 model, i5 4th gen, 4gb memory) HDD was crying. I’m not a gamer or a power user, just a regular user. Yet, SSD has given my laptop a new life. Some approx comparison times I’ve observed: 1) Boot up = HDD 2 mins; SSD 20 seconds 2) Sleep to wake = HDD 2 mins; SSD 3 seconds 3) Opening chrome = HDD 20 seconds; SSD 3 seconds ... and many more such improvements. Worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Sandeep M

customer_reviews.title: Faster boot
customer_reviews.text: First thing I did was time how long from a cold boot to Desktop with network connectivity. 37.48 seconds. Data copy process with included software was seamless and took about 36 minutes for 2 partitions, 210GB and 540GB. No issues. Next was timing after just initial install. 29.08 seconds. Then I ran the first part of the optimization, and retimed. 27.34 seconds Then enabled the Rapid Option with Samsung OverSpeed partition at 10% drive size. 21.12 seconds. So clearly, it boots much faster. But also I notice every application seems to open much faster. Web browsing also has less hanging on page loading. Overall, the laptop from 2011 feels a lot faster today.
customer_reviews.author: Ricka

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to upgrade your notebooks harddrive
customer_reviews.text: Need a larger hard drive... look no further! The upgrade was simple and easy to do on my Windows computer. After upgrading my notebook with this drive I had my husband purchase one for his Macbook. It comes with software that does all the work for you. I also bought the following hard drive enclosure (note it is USB 3.0): Just put the drive into the enclosure and then plug it into a USB 3.0 port. Follow the directions that come with the hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzy

customer_reviews.title: Bingo! My laptop with a SSD is now a top performer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an HP Pavilion 15 Touchscreen Laptop - Intel Core i5 recently. It seemed a little slow for an i5 Intel processor so I ran the Passmark software on it and discovered the score for the processor was very good. It was the hard drive that was slow and gave a 752.9 score on the test. So I purchased the Samsung 858 EVO 500GB SSD and installed it in place of the original hard drive. Bingo!! The Passmark rating on the SSD is now 3926.5. That is a major improvement and turned the laptop into a nice performer. So I am very happy that I purchased this solid state drive.
customer_reviews.author: JDIZZY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hard drive, and very reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I was going through some old records and realized I had not rated this Samsung drive yet. The drive was purchased in 2016 to update an aging DELL and after its system board finally died I transferred the drive to a newer HP and it is still going strong. Great upgrade for any magnetic disc machine (if you still have one) and the longevity is pretty awesome. Installation into both machines was seamless and improved the performance of both units by a factor of 4 to 8. A good deal in any case if you want to give a few more years to an old favorite piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: New life for an older laptop...
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this on a MacBook Pro (13-inch, Mid 2012) and boot times went from several minutes to around 20-30 seconds. I used theto install a fresh copy of OS X and migrate my data between drives. I booted into recovery partition on the local system (can also be done with install disk), installed a copy of OS X onto the new drive, then when that was complete I ran the migration assistant when prompted. I booted into the still external SSD using the boot menu to verify it was working. After the drive was verified I took the old hard drive out and installed this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G.

customer_reviews.title: I am happy, the change is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I am happy, the change is awesome, thank God I ran smoothly, what I did was to directly install the Samsung 850EVO to the Macbook Pro 2012 and do the installation of the operating system from scratch (Turn on the mac and press the cmd and R key until Out the internet network.) In the photos you see the deference of speed between the two albums, it is impressive. I hope to always work without inconveniences. I managed to buy it in promotion $ 129.99
customer_reviews.author: Milena

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hard drive. Time will tell, but with my experience in ssd's, I figure it will be fine until it is so old a new technology will be demanded. I have 4 850 pro drives also, this one is for a residential computer that gets about no use (mother in law), it obviously sped up here old core 2 duo machine (with 4 gb) immensely (w10). Overkill, but I told her that when she gets a new pc that this would still be an excellent drive to keep. If you don't have your OS running on ssd then it is seriously pointless to upgrade your ram or processor. You will see that your hdd is the bottle neck.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Scotty1234

customer_reviews.title: SSD inside is now a must!
customer_reviews.text: Daughter was complaining that laptop was old and I needed to buy her a new one. I cleaned up her startup applications and replaced her 5400RPM drive with this. She could not believe that it was the same drive. There really is a huge difference in performance. As for migration, there are many free tools to perform the migration. I bought  so that I could clone the existing drive to the SSD (I prefer to have SSD sitting on table next to laptop as there are no moving parts; less vibration than a disk that is actually spinning inside). Would I buy again? I bought 4 drives and have replaced all of our drives now.
customer_reviews.author: Edak

customer_reviews.title: The data migration does not support Mac
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a few EVO drives for Win 10 devices, and love the simplicity of the data migration feature. This software does NOT work with a Mac, though. I didn't know that. Thus, it took a while to get the job done, though I learned a lot in the process. The Mid-2010 Mac Mini runs like a champ now. If I was buying for a Windows machine, this is the only brand I consider since I've always had such good results.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P. Moran

customer_reviews.title: Pure performance!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Super fast and I'm glad I picked Samsung EVO over other brands. Update: The SSD worked about a week than it stopped working. My laptop couldn’t detect the drive anymore. Apparently some batches of this model comes with a bad connector and it loses the signal, and become unusable. I should have read the reviews more carefully left by the Amazon customers before purchasing the drive. Anyway, I contacted amazon customer service and of course, top notch amazing customer service will replace it at no cost. I will give a try again and hopefully I will strike a gold this time.
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance buy Drive Crashed - see comments
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a primary hard drive and it crashed in a desktop pc after two months. Someone advised me to adjust power settings in Windows 10 to hard drive is always on with full power. Perhaps, but I went to a WD Black for replacement. I am giving 3 stars instead of one because when it works, it words very very well. My problem may be due to setup??? I have a Crucial 500GB SSD in a MacBook Pro for over 6 months. That has worked great - dependable and MUCH faster boots and system response.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: misleading advertisement of product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased product as advertised as the American (AM) version of this device and was shipped a European version. (EU). Part stopped working 6 weeks after installation and tried to return it. Manufacture says I must go to a European distributor for replacement. if I had known that I would not have bought the product. the advertised product was not the item that was shipped . need a replacement with a AM at end of part number as originally advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Charlieh6

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended and then some.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted perfectly into the removable case housing (Cooler Master series, extendable bay adapter). Besides a little quick initialization requirement in the MMC disk manager utility, the baby powered right up and was ready to go instantly. I have had no problems with its transfer rates or read/processing capability for direct to VR and thunderbolt related requirements. An awesome SSD product in the age of M.2 and Msata options. Good to have for storage and usability in this day and age.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Myhra

customer_reviews.title: PNY is just as good and half the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this and I have to say that it is really just on par with the PNY SSD, the difference in speed is not noticeable and for the price difference. I have switched over to the PNY SSD's without any issue. Though Samsung is a great brand, I am running multiple machines on a budget and frankly dont mind going with the alternative. I will stay out of the 1990's "sony" trap and buy for either longevity or budget, not for brand
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Jamz

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for 2009 iMac
customer_reviews.text: I installed this drive in a Late 2009 iMac along with the OWC Thermal sensor. The difference an SSD makes is incredible. This aging iMac is snappy to use and is very enjoyable in everyday use. I have a Qnap NAS that I use to store documents so 500GB is more than enough currently I am using about 91 GB on the drive. Changing a drive in an iMac is not an easy or enjoyable project so get a drive with a good reputation for reliability. I made the mistake of buying a cheaper drive, won't do that again.
customer_reviews.author: Jose F. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Buy One
customer_reviews.text: Do you have a solid state drive yet? This is one of the best computer breakthroughs ever. A faster CPU is great at speeding up intense calculations, but those don't happen very often on an average computer. A SSD speeds up everything. Faster boot times, faster program opening, faster file transfers... Everything is better with a SSD buy one (or two) today!
customer_reviews.author: Active Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Bought two of them about two months ago. Unfortunately ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of them about two months ago. Unfortunately it seems I used the defective one for my boot drive. It would be goofy every now and then when I first installed, and restart. Now I just get an error that says it can't boot or fix the issue, luckily I still had my old 830(6 or 7 year old drive) with the OS still on it. Can't say much for the other one as I had bought it for another reason and haven't used it much, but the one I needed to work doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: WCFTX

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping and believe it'll be the perfect present our son wanted/needed to add to his PC
customer_reviews.text: Fast Shipping and believe it'll be the perfect present our son wanted/needed to add to his PC. Also included was the mounting bracket for $7.00 more which you may not need but, for $7.00, we figured we wouldnt have to look for screws or anything else in order to have it installed. I'll report back if he has any issues once installed but, do not believe we will after reading all the TOP reviews for this product!
customer_reviews.author: K. Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: FLASH>>>>> DRIVE
customer_reviews.text: What a difference in speed and productivity this item has made. My MACBOOK PRO mid 2012 was freezing and apps didn't load for several minutes and I decided to investigate what the possible problems could be. I found many others had the same problem and a solution was thisHighly recommend a SSD over a hard drive, FLASH>>>>> DRIVE
customer_reviews.author: D.Charriez

customer_reviews.title: 500GB is a pretty good sweet-spot for an SSD
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast, living up to it's advertised speeds with the proper hardware and drivers. 500GB is a pretty good sweet-spot for an SSD. Its enough to not need a second HDD for storage, and enough to load the games you play every day. I liked it so much I bought three, 2 being of the 250GB variety. I don't recommend anyone who owns this to use the "RAPID" feature, however. While it shows little performance gains here and there, it mucks up the accuracy of benchmarks, eats RAM (as it uses RAM to cache reads), and can make some games randomly jitter.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Like Having a New Computer
customer_reviews.text: For me, this was the magic answer to a painfully slow, old Mac. I am not an IT person and have average computer knowledge, but replacing my old magnetic hard drive with this puppy was pretty simple. Just be sure you have the correct tools (my old iPhone batter change kist had everything I needed). I did have to deduce a few steps from online instructions, based on slight differences in newer Disk Utility menus - but really its fairly intuitive. Installing this drive on my 6-year-old Mac made it feel new again, and it saved me the cost of a new computer.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: When your data is at stake, go with the category leader, which is the 850 EVO
customer_reviews.text: My Dell Latitude 3550 started slowing down with its mechanical HD, and I finally decided to make the plunge into ssd. It's a simple two step process - 1. migrate data; 2. install ssd. 1. Migrating requires connecting the ssd to the laptop as was. Had to buy an external USB adapter to do that. Samsung's migration software was a breeze, fool-proof, and took only a couple of hours. 2. Opening the laptop, removing old HD, installing ssd. Took 3 minutes. Turn laptop on - everything is where I left it, only much much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: If you are using Windows 10, you NEED to download the latest Samsung software
customer_reviews.text: If you are migrating a Windows 10 computer, be sure to get the latest version (3.0, as of today) of the Samsung Migration software from  My SSD came with version 2.7, which does not work with Windows 10. If you are trying to run this software on Windows 10 and it won't see your new SSD, this is probably why. Once I got the new software from Samsung, the migration to the SSD was easy. And the computer is so much faster now. It used to take a good minute to boot my computer, now it's just a few seconds! Easily the most cost effective PC upgrade, ever. You'll want to get a USB cable, like this one:
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Madigan

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase and Easy Upgrade; HUGE improvement for my MBP
customer_reviews.text: This made a huge IMPROVEMENT to my: MacBook Pro (15-inch, Early 2011) 2.2 GHz Intel Core i7 I added this drive AFTER increasing my RAM, and was blown away by the performance improvement. This purchase has definitely helped extend the useful life of my laptop! The installation process couldn't have been easier either. I used this tool set ( to remove the necessary parts, and followed some simple online instructions for cloning and installing the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, fast, zero
customer_reviews.text: Keep buying Samsung SSD's because they are easy to install, fast and never have hiccups. Have more Samsung SSD's by now than I can count from 60 GB to 1 TB so far. Never had any problems. Also got some of the PRO models - but never noticed any difference. If you are making an upgrade the Samsung software is just excellent (get a package with connector etc. if you do not have it). Plain install is so easy. Pop into PC or laptop - win10 will do the rest. I use the magician software from Samsung. Not sure how much of a difference it makes. But seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Maiaibing

customer_reviews.title: Samsung cloning/migration software that comes with SSD works great with Windows 10 !
customer_reviews.text: Samsung cloning/migration software that comes with SSD works great with Windows 10 ! Easy !! Great upgrade for our old HP Laptops until new less expensive laptops come out with SSDs included. Bought a second for my wife's laptop.. also was great upgrade ! Please note: Must buy a migration cable on Amazon, $12 ish, that works specifically for Samsung EVO 850 separately !!! Would buy another one, SSD was a big improvement, faster response time, over HDD that came with laptop !.
customer_reviews.author: CaS

customer_reviews.title: Working great and running at the speeds promised
customer_reviews.text: Working great and running at the speeds promised. I'm thinking about getting another one. Fair warning to those with OEM recovery media for Windows, it may not take well to this drive. I bought it for my wife's HP m7-j010dx laptop and even though we had a good recovery drive made it would not accept this drive. Updated the bios and still had no luck. We had to use a retail disc to do the installation. Fortunately I already had one of those. That isn't the fault of the drive, but it is something good to be aware of before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: N. Linney

customer_reviews.title: I now have a much more responsive computer
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research on SSD Drives, I decided on and ordered the Samsung 850 EVO 500GB 2.5-Inch SATA III. I cloned my C drive with Easeus Todo Backup freeware, replaced the drive, and everything went as expected. I subsequently downloaded and installed the Samsung Magician, and set the drive to High Performance. Needless to say, I now have a much more responsive computer. I told friends about this drive, and subsequently installed this drive on two laptops, and three desktops from HP and Dell. I used the Sabrent SSD & SATA Hard Drive Mounting Kit with the desktops. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: LN Hamasaki

customer_reviews.title: Saved my computer
customer_reviews.text: Never install your OS on a single, massive partition, then procede to fill up the entire 2T capacity of your slow-ass HDD with stuff. My computer was slower and more constipated than a rush-hour traffic jam. Popped in this bad boy (had to go to the computer store and buy a mounting rack, was 4 dollars), installed Windows on it, and the old drive is just for storage now. There is now practically no drunken-ness period after the computer boots, and pretty much everything is more responsive now. I waited patiently for years for SSDs to become affordable, and I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the factory magnetic hard drive in my daughters new ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the factory magnetic hard drive in my daughters new laptop with this for two reasons. First, this is so much faster than that awful factory drive. Second, my daughter is young, and isn't the most careful with her devices, and I knew that a classic hard drive was going to fail quick with her bumping it around. This drive solved both those issues making the laptop both fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Glendon Luettgerodt

customer_reviews.title: If you are still using a HDD just buy a SSD already!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not but this SSD actually seems to perform Slower than the Crucial M500 SSD that I replaced it with. I wasnt expecting much improvement over the crucial as I bought it mostly for the doubled capacity, but it truly seems to perform a little slower in real life. Its not a big deal, but I guess most of the Great reviews here are from people upgrading from a HDD to a SSD, and in that case the performance jump is simply amazing!!!! Adding a SSD such as this is hands down to BEST possible upgrade you can do to ANY older computer that is still using a HDD !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Fritchman

customer_reviews.title: Works great and comes with awesome software!
customer_reviews.text: Was upgrading my roommate's computer that was super old. Bought this to use as the boot drive (as well as startup programs and such) and it works perfectly. I even bought one for myself not too long ago (probably 6 or so months) and that one is still running amazing. The program that Samsung made for cloning a previous drive or checking the health of this drive is absolutely outstanding. Love this product! (Note: You don't HAVE to use their programs or download anything to use the drive. Just plug it in, turn on your pc, and go!)
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Performs exactly as expected, very simple install
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else I have been wondering if paying for the Samsung V NAND drives was worth the price. My experience thus far has been flawless. Wizard ghosted my old drive with out issue and performance is hitting the highest expected marks. I am very happy with the thermal properties of the drive which has actually LOWERED the temps I am reading from my laptop. While $150 is steep for 500Gb. The 5 year warranty is wonderful. No more expensive than similar technology from ADATA with a 3 year
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Fulton

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous performance with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best SSD on the market today in terms of price vs. performance. The performance tops any SSD I've ever owned. Only problem I had was with the installation/data migration software because it created (without asking) a 100MB System Reserved Partition in Windows 8.1 that was nearly impossible to update to Windows 10 because it was 99% full and couldn't easily be modified or relocated. I had to use third-party partitioning tools to enlarge the partition so that the Windows 10 installer would run to completion. Subtract one star for the migration/installation software, but nothing to complain about on the hardware side. Recommended as long as you avoid the Samsung SSD installation software.
customer_reviews.author: mmarkows

customer_reviews.title: Works well in my Macs!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these drives and they're both great. One has been installed in a 2008 Macbook Pro for over a year and continues to function flawlessly. This is an option for anyone looking for an SSD that will work at full SATA II speed in a computer with an Nvidia MCP79 SATA controller. I purchased the other drive for use in a 2009 Mac Pro. That drive is installed in a PCIe SATA III adapter () in order to utilize the drive at full SATA III speed. The drive functions flawlessly in this configuration. In short: these drives are an excellent value. High speed, low price, and a five year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: whippo

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I've had 0 problems with the installation not function. Great to set your computer to boot from as it speeds up the process ten fold. Games load very fast and in all it's a very solid product I highly recommend it if you want to add some speed to your loading times. It does not speed up online games load times though as that is a server issue on the games end.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Totally Transformed my 2011 Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Bought and installed this to upgrade my model 2011 MacBook Pro with a 512GB HDD. The difference is BEYOND night and day. It is truly like a brand new machine in terms of speed. Exceeded my expecations in every way. A total no-brainer. Easy install too (just follow YouTube videos). Took maybe 10 minutes. Longest part by far was transferring my 300gb's of files. For that I used Carbon Copy Cloner. Very pleased with this purchase. Best $160 I think I've ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SSD upgrade from HDD!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Samsung SSD to upgrade the internal 5400 RPM HDD on my Windows 10 Toshiba laptop. Drive comes with a migration software CD but it's an older version so I suggest downloading the latest from Samsung's website. Migration was quick and very easy using even for non-technical individuals, just follow the instructions. I'm sure it's applicable to most SSD brands out there and knew there would be speed increase between SSD and HDD but I didn't expect the improvement to be this significant! Windows 10 starts up in about five seconds, tops!
customer_reviews.author: Jr.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: great performer, no problems.
customer_reviews.text: this device has been a great performer, no problems. replaced the slow 5400RPM drive in a dell i7720SE laptop with this SSD. the difference in overall system performance is VERY impressive, better than anticipated. with the fast SSD installed, the laptop's 8GB RAM limitation of no longer seems to an issue since paging from the SSD is so much faster. Windows 10 system startup from 'Power OFF state' to 'logged in state' is also VERY fast.
customer_reviews.author: rcox52

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and fast read/write speeds! I store my games and videos on this
customer_reviews.text: 500gb might not be enough for a few. But it was enough for me until 3 years later. I think I can easily pass with 1TB next time if I decide to upgrade and switch out. But this one has never gave me any problems and I trust it. The price at the time was too good to pass up for its reliability and performance.
customer_reviews.author: iBertz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drive.
customer_reviews.text: Reliable performer. My first foray into SSDs were with very cheap drives, and between failures and pathetic performace, I wasn't impressed. Then I decided to go with the overwhelmingly positive reviews the 850 EVO had everywhere and the experience is in every way better. Boot times reduced to seconds in both Ubuntu and Windows 10, application start times down to nothing, exactly what I was expecting with previous units but never actually got. Samsung's reputation is fairly earned.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Fast, great warranty, followed by near idiot proof migration software.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy install for my Thinkpad T470 running Windows 10. Hooked the SDD into the USB (nothing seemed to be happening), downloaded the Samsung Data Migration program from the website, and followed the prompts. That was it, by the time I got done washing dishes the program had run it's course, I flipped the laptop over, popped out the old slow, HDD and plugged in the new lighting fast SSD. Other than a tremendous boost in speed you would not even know something changed.
customer_reviews.author: JasonD

customer_reviews.title: Best all-around storage product
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to add my vote to the other 17,000+ reviews for this product. I have a bunch of these SSDs, and it has been the best storage product I've ever purchased, when considering all the points of performance, price, etc. I've used these drives in laptops, external backup enclosures, in RAID-0 arrays, in HEDT platforms, and in 10 year old media servers. They just always work. Atto benchmarking shows results that are close to the Samsung PRO line of SSDs (no need for me to post results; they match other reviewers' screenshots). I'll keep buying them as long as they keep making them.
customer_reviews.author: The Mighty Thalurian, Emperor of Zornax IV

customer_reviews.title: Insanely fast. No mounting bracket/tray.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t purchased an SSD in a number of years, so I was surprised that it didn’t come with any type of mounting tray. It didn’t line up with anything in my hard drive bays, so I just friction taped it to the underside of the bay. I figure it’s okay because there aren’t any moving bits. Update: After using this as storage for games, I can say that this thing as reaaaaally fast. Testing shows 500+ Mb/sec every time. Crazy.
customer_reviews.author: TheChrisCarman

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I replaced our OE laptop drive with this SSD. At the time of replacement this was one of the best on the market in terms of read write speeds. It made a huge difference in speed that is readily noticable on boot up. The speed at which you can turn on, log into and begin working with your computer is a night and day difference to an older sata style drive.
customer_reviews.author: oldsouth

customer_reviews.title: Beware, if this unit should fail.
customer_reviews.text: I was unfortunate enough to get a bad drive that failed just short of one year old, and without any warning. A 5 year warranty is all well and good, but the reality is something else. Hey folks, you may want to get familiar with Samsung's warranty procedure. There are enough hoops to jump through to make you just want to toss it in the trash instead. Very disappointed. Replaced it with a Crucial model from amazon. Hoping it will survive the test of time better than this thing did.
customer_reviews.author: ChristopherBear

customer_reviews.title: Installed in my iMac 27" (Mid 2011)
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone says, it's like having a brand new computer! When I wake up the computer there is no delays, I can switch users (wife and I) and no delays either. Everything is so fast, speeds are 493 MB/s to write and 510 MB/s to read. Amazing and totally silent. I used the following cable to connect the SSD:  Follow this video to install drive:  After installing I made the SSD my boot up drive, all apps are there. The original drive (2TB) is now my second drive where I put all my pictures and videos. Stop thinking about it and get this SSD, it's totally worth it! If you have any questions, just ask.
customer_reviews.author: JFLY

customer_reviews.title: New life to old system
customer_reviews.text: This drive is just solid. I replaced my 10K rpm VelociRaptor drive with this and boot times are amazing. Because my system is kind of old, I also installed the Samsung Magician software to optimize the drive, as well as perform TRIM operations on the drive to keep it running efficiently. When I built my system, SATA 3 was just becoming available on motherboards. As a matter of fact, my motherboard only contains two SATA 3 ports and 8 SATA 2 ports. So if you're not a SSD wizard and you want to maximize the drive's capability, ensure ACHI is enabled on you motherboard/computer and use the Magician software to optimize the drive to get the best result.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade for old computers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to upgrade my 2012 Toshiba laptop from a HDD to SSD. My old computer went from taking 20 minutes to open any program to less than 10 seconds. I even run CAD programs on it with pretty much no lag! It took my "once really nice but now completely unusable" old laptop to a reasonable computer again (granted the graphics card and other things are still old, but still, it works). Also I followed the instructions for transferring data and everything and it worked pretty smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: mrox

customer_reviews.title: Did I mention it was fast?
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a sloooow 1 TB 5200 RPM conventional drive on a new laptop, i7 8GB RAM. Boot time went from 2 minutes to 10 seconds from start to the desktop. At 71 I don't have time to waste waiting for a computer to boot up. I highly recommend the Samsung SSD drives, having installed several. This one is no different.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: My favorite SSD
customer_reviews.text: Boy do I really love these Samsung SSDs the Samsung software could not be any easier to use, the software is very clear and let's you understand what it's doing. I used the migration tool to clone my existing hard drive and once it was finished and I installed on the new PC I had no issues I don't even need to type in any passwords. Then I ran the magician software and it made all the edits to Windows that benefits the SSDs performance and now in less than one minute I can go from shut down to answering and email in outlook on my business computer
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this drive to anyone looking for great storage performance
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. I have 3 drives on my computer. A 250gb ssd main drive, WD 1tb hard drive for games, and just installed the Samsung 500gb EVO SSD to see if I could speed up a couple of my games that seemed to take for ever changing scenes. Using the EVO has made a major difference. Todays games require more modern technology to run them. The games not only change scenes 3 times faster, but also don't freeze up any longer since I installed The Samsung 850 EVO. I highly recommend this drive to anyone looking for great storage performance.
customer_reviews.author: cj385

customer_reviews.title: Rejuvenated my old Pentium 4
customer_reviews.text: Noticeably sped up my old Pentium 4 computer. I would recommend this over adding more RAM. Some small tips and issues. Make sure to update the migration software (you will be offered that option). If you don't the transfer will fail. Another important tip; Make sure to order a StarTech USB 3.0 to 2.5 SATA HDD/SSD Cable. The hard drive does not come with it and without the cable there is no way to transfer over data from your existing drive.
customer_reviews.author: RSM

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: By far, this is one of the biggest and best upgrades you can make to a laptop. Especially an older one that you've previously maxed out the memory on. The speed increase especially during boot-up is incredible. Moving from a physical disk drive to this isn't hard at all. There is a utility that you can download from Samsung that will do the job for you (provided you have a USB-SATA drive interface). once the OS/data is copied over just swap out the drives and enjoy the speed increase. Worth the money expended especially if you cant afford a new laptop yet!
customer_reviews.author: Rene Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: What I wanted and expected.
customer_reviews.text: On time. What I ordered. Well packaged. Currently downloading updates to the device so I know it is functioning properly. I've built 5 other systems around Samsung SSDs and do not bother to consider other options. Samsung produces the NAND for other vendors but I find no reason to not purchase Samsung. The Magician software is not a requirement for new builds. Do your homework and see if you need it.
customer_reviews.author: MagnoliaTexas

customer_reviews.title: This is like upgrading to a V8 when you are used to driving a 4 cylinder.
customer_reviews.text: My early 2011 MacBook Pro was on its last leg as far as speed was concerned. As a full time DJ and musician, this MacBook was my beat up MBP so I wouldn't beat my newer one up too much. I needed a new battery anyway, so I figured I would update to an SSD while I was opening my MBP up. My laptop performs just as fast as my 2011 MBP, but now has 250 more gb of storage. I am 100% happy since I saved myself about $1,000 had I purchased another laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Rockstar Denied

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive.  Great price
customer_reviews.text: My factory drive for my Mac mini was starting to go so I took to store. They wanted a lot of money to replace with the same model which was a standard drive. Instead, I opted for this solid state drive. A youtube video later on how to replace the drive on the Mac mini, then 20 minutes and I was operating much faster than before. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I recently upgraded every single component in my computer EXCEPT my hard drive to the latest and greatest stuff and to be honest
customer_reviews.text: If you have an HDD and your thinking about upgrading to this... Stop thinking! I recently upgraded every single component in my computer EXCEPT my hard drive to the latest and greatest stuff and to be honesty I almost didn't even notice the difference in performance. From boot/load times to graphically intensive gaming. That was until I bought this SSD. I cut loading times by several times. I'd say my computer is at least 5 to 6 times faster with this thing. This is hands down the most noticeable upgrade you can give to your PC if you are upgrading from a HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: First DOA, Second time's the charm!  Great performance!
customer_reviews.text: First one died after about a week (corrupt system files and terrible performance). We think that might have been pretty much DOA (controller?) because the second seemed to perform MUCH better upon installation and mounting of the OS. Fantastic value for the money. The only thing that's confusing is the warranty. The Amazon listing page advertises a 5-year warranty, but the Warranty pdf you can download from the same page is written as a 3-year warranty. EDIT: Samsung responded to this review and clarified warranty. And I decided that with the awesome increase in performance, and the fact that some products do fail prematurely, this drive merits 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: JayO

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I installed this SSD on my Thinkpad T450s laptop almost 4 years ago. The performance improved and it is working perfectly ever since. I use my PC for primarily for work, during 9 to 11 hours a day so it is working very well given the number of hours of operation that I have used so far.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo P. Silva Prado

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Fast drive for a low price. I added this to my system where my OCZ Vertex 4 256GB was getting full. The Samsung ships with software, which I usually ignore, however in this case the offering is very useful. First of all, there is a management tool that you can use to tweak the performance of the drive. And the second utility is a clone utility. This one is absolutely essential. I used this to completely clone my existing 256GB drive to this new drive. I was up and running with my full, intact Windows installation in about 15 minutes. No need for a fresh install of the operating system.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: Windows 10 loads in 12 seconds. This tells it all. Installation allows a complete transfer of your C drive to the SSD and then it is ready to reboot and start anew. The whole C drive uses less than 50% of the SSD. One of my best purchases. Have had it for two years at least, now. Has performed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Yves Chaix

customer_reviews.title: EVO - Always the best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: First off, the Samsung EVO series SSDS are phenomenal. I've used several over the past few years, using them to replace slower spinning disk.. Wow, what a difference it makes in almost any SATA3 ready system. Purchased the 500GB SSD to replace a failed hard drive for a laptop. Installed a fresh copy of Windows 10, installation was very quick and easy. Took less than a few minutes to install and boot into Windows. Cut my boot time from 30s+ to around 8-10s from Power Off --> Logged in and working. This fits 2.5" drive slots, and is extremely compact at 7mm thickness.
customer_reviews.author: pandacoreg

customer_reviews.title: Super fast and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and quiet! No issues replacing an HDD once I cloned it. Just one word of caution - I used the provided Samsung software to clone the HDD initially, and it didn't quite cut the mustard. It ignored some of the hidden partitions related to recovery. It did clone the OS without issue, and it booted just fine, but it couldn't create a recovery disk. So I used a third party clone software instead (Macrium) and it worked flawlessly. I would highly recommend this SSD to anyone wanting a quick upgrade to their current laptop. As long as you have a SATA HDD, you can upgrade, and you WILL notice the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: The Samsung SSD is great. The down grade in the rating reflects the ...
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to clone a Corsair SSD to a Samsung 850 EVO SSD (Win 10) using the software included with the Samsung SSD. The Samsung Cloning software would not recognize the Corsair (source disk). Received an Error Msg: "This device not supported." Had to use Lazesoft cloning software to clone the Corsair SSD. The Samsung SSD is great. The down grade in the rating reflects the frustration in having to find software that would do the cloning.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Howell

customer_reviews.title: Always great performance
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding? Of course this gets FIVE stars. Duh? LOL. On my latest build, this is getting around 500 MB/sec read/write and that's without any RAID controllers or caching. Just 1 SSD plugged straight into the MOBO. This is used in a photo editing rig and has met all expectations. I am currently using four 850 PROs in my video editing rig, and they are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Buras

customer_reviews.title: Small, Light, and Fast but you need some technical ability.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this SSD for my steam games. Warning, This SSD doesn't come with a hard drive cable. I just assumed that it would since my Corsair Neutron GTX SSD came with one, but that was my mistake. So, make sure to get a 6 GB/s cable in order to get the full performance from this SSD. Out the box, it's clocking speeds of 300mb/s. Turns out you have to download Samsung Magician app and then turn on Rapid mode in the advanced settings. But, the product itself is really fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Bleeksano

customer_reviews.title: Therapy for your PC
customer_reviews.text: A friend once told me that upgrading a machine was akin to putting your machine to physical therapy/rehabilitation. Putting this drive into a old laptop (old Sony Vaio) I could see what he meant. This will give my old laptop at lease few more years of life. Strongly recommended. P.S; If you bought this to clone your drive, I recommend, if possible, just doing an clean install of your OS and reinstalling your software to them later, I found that there is enough performance improvement to make the hassle worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy Korean!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a billion times better than the Crucial MX100 that my laptop still cannot boot from. This EVO worked on the first try. I hate the way you can lose faith in technology because you made a bad purchase and you didn't realize it was the device, not the idea. Then Samsung comes along and restores my faith in engineering over marketing. I've had Samsung phones, tablets, printers, VCRs and TV's and have never had a problem with any of them. Buy Korean!
customer_reviews.author: Michael2255

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Transformation
customer_reviews.text: I have Toshiba Satellite P775-S7215, which I long fantasized of driving over with my minivan. I've had multiple problems with it, and support from Toshiba and Best Buy was appalling in both cases, so when it also became unbearably slow I had very little hope for it. In fact, I had parked it in a corner for several months. Then I decided to give it one last chance with this SSD. Wow! Absolutely amazing transformation. I actually like this computer again. And: the included data migration software worked like a charm. Just remember to get the SATA cable if you don't already have one ... that little detail doesn't seem to be mentioned in the product description. Otherwise: all good!
customer_reviews.author: William Hoke

customer_reviews.title: The Best SSD
customer_reviews.text: This SSD is the best thing that ever happened to my laptop. My PC is so much faster after having installed this, and if you are someone who has a lot of audio files and is interested in graphic design I would definitely spring for the larger SSD. Coming from larger HDDs (like 750GB, 1TB, or 2TB) it can be harder to down size, but as long as you have an external drive to put non-necessities on you should be ok with only 500GB.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: My 2009 MacBook is "new" again!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 2 of these. Installed one on my mid-2009 MacBook that was at 90% capacity on the 160 GB HDD, and it's like I have a brand new computer! Everything runs super fast and now I have plenty space for photos & videos. I use Parallels to run Windows so I can use Quicken Premier (Quicken for Mac just doesn't have the functionality) and I have no issues using Quicken and multiple iOS applications simultaneously. I installed the other SSD on my wife 2012 MBP (also upgraded the RAM from 4 GB to 8 GB), and its performance has improved significantly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny B

product_meta.title: Samsung 850 EVO 500GB 2.5-Inch SATA III Internal SSD (MZ-75E500B/AM)
product_meta.description: Upgrading your PC with a Samsung SSD is the most economical way to breathe new life into an aging PC. The 850 EVO reads, writes and multi tasks at incredible speeds, enhancing boot up speed, application loading and multi tasking performance. It's more than an upgrade, it's a complete transformation of your PC.
feature_bullets: Powered by Samsung V NAND Technology; Optimized Performance for Everyday Computing. Interface: SATA 6Gb/s Interface, compatible with SATA 3Gb/s & SATA 1.5Gb/s interfaceGb/s
Incredible Sequential Read/Write Performance : Up to 540MB/s and 520MB/s Respectively, and Random Read/Write IOPS Performance : Up to 98K and 90K Respectively
Endurance, Energy Efficiency, Reliability and a 5 Years Limited Warranty
Included Contents: 2.5 Inches (7 millimeter) SATA III (6GB/s) SSD & User Manual (All Other Cables, Screws, Brackets Not Included)
Free download of Samsung Data Migration and Magician software available for easy installation and SSD management

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars8,708 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
